learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate an organisation’s need for corporate sustainability.
Analyse the relationship between corporate activity, environmental change, and social impact.
Construct the moral, legal, and business case for sustainability using relevant ethical and regulatory frameworks.
Design change strategies that create sustainable value and support long-term organisational transformation.
In teams, co-create sustainability outcomes inclusive of diverse communities, including Australian Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island Peoples.
Reflect on the importance of leadership and collaboration in achieving sustainable action.

assessments.task_description:
You will need to actively manage an area of your own sustainability. Over a ten (10) day period you will need to record your experience (photos/notes). A short reflective essay will be submitted addressing key questions (provided below) including applying academic literature including the article provided in Blackboard to evaluate your experience. 

ADDITIONAL NOTES:

  • This project is to be completed INDIVIDUALLY.
  • Word length: 1500 words maximum, excluding references and appendices.
  • This assignment needs to be academically referenced with a minimum of 3 academic references.

assessments.task_description:
This assignment requires you to write a critical reflection on leadership for sustainability drawing on your experience in the Change Management Simulation: Power and Influence. Using your decisions, outcomes, and interactions in the simulation as empirical material, reflect on how leadership operates under conditions of organizational politics, competing interests, and unequal power. Rather than describing what happened in the simulation, your task is to analyse what the simulation reveals about leadership in promoting sustainability, particularly in relation to influence, resistance, coalition-building, and ethical judgment.

ADDITIONAL NOTES:

  • This project is to be completed INDIVIDUALLY.
  • Word length: 1000 words maximum, excluding references and appendices.
  • This assignment needs to be academically referenced with a minimum of 3 academic references.

learning_activities.topic:
The Drivers for Sustainability

The seminar focuses on the drivers of organisational change for sustainability. Includes globalisation, regulation, SDGs, new business models and others.

learning_activities.topic:
The Phases of Sustainability

Understand the phases of organisational sustainability. Identify key aspects used to evaluate companies and their position on the path to sustainability.
learning_activities.topic_description: The Phases of Sustainability Understand the phases of organisational sustainability. Identify key aspects used to evaluate companies and their position on the path to sustainability.

learning_activities.topic:
Leadership and Change Approaches to Sustainability

This seminar considers change with a focus on both incremental and transformational change. We consider leadership and the appropriate types of change for a given circumstance, steps of implementation and considerations.
learning_activities.topic_description: Leadership and Change Approaches to Sustainability This seminar considers change with a focus on both incremental and transformational change. We consider leadership and the appropriate types of change for a given circumstance, steps of implementation and considerations.

learning_activities.topic:
The Value of Sustainability

Understanding the value of sustainability projects to an organisation. Consideration of how to calculate value consistent with a focus on environmental, social and financial outcomes.

learning_activities.topic:
Change Management

This seminar explores how organizational change is shaped by power, influence, and informal networks rather than formal plans alone. We will examine why successful change depends on coalition-building and timing. This is explored through a Harvard Simulation.
